name: La Quinta Inn & Suites New Haven

reviews.text: Overall good stay at this hotel. Looked recently renovated hallways. Quiet, surprisingly roomy, and clean room on 7th floor. New bed mattresses. Clean bathroom. Despite the room facing the I-95, it was quiet. One big negative -- noisy A/C-heater unit. Free breakfast was marginal. Breakfast staff busy chatting and didn't really care to replenish the foods. It is about 10 minutes drive to downtown/Yale. It is a reasonable priced hotel around the area. Noticed there is IKEA nearby. Yes, would return again, if visiting Yale.
reviews.title: good valued hotel, with few minuses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conveniently located off I-95, parking is limited. The woman at check in was very pleasant. The room was disappointing. The window was disgustingly dirty. The bathroom did not look overly clean either. One elevator was a little sketchy as to whether it was working or not, and we had to have our room keys reactivated the day after we checked in.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.text: My stay at LaQuinta got off to a bad start. They were having substantial computer problems and kept messing up my room assignment. My first room was on the 2d floor. Key didn't work. I went back to the front desk and got another key. It still didn't work. After a few tries, a boy opened the door from the inside to see what was going on! (And yes, it was the room I'd been assigned.) tried again and got a 5th floor room. This time the key worked, and nobody was there...but there were two suitcases, a bottle of medicine and a toothbrush in a glass...so they were 0 for 2 in assigning me an unoccupied room. They then told me they had no more nonsmoking rooms and a smoking room was all they had. . So, I took it, but not happily. The 8th floor room wasn't too smoky, but the hallway sure smelled strongly of smoke.
reviews.title: Bad start, good finish

reviews.text: The next morning, I went to the front desk to ask for a nonsmoking room for the rest of my stay. The clerk could not have been more helpful, apologized and got me a fine nonsmoking room on the 7th floor. The manager overheard me and apologized profusely and offered to give me my second night's stay for free (and apologized to me two more times during my stay). Anyone's computer can be messed up, but I was very impressed by how hard they worked to make things right. I really feel like they got to know me and I was very impressed by all of the staff, except the first clerk.
reviews.title: The place to stay for graduation

reviews.text: There's a lot to like about this place, actually. They have a free shuttle within 5 miles of the hotel, which includes Yale and all of downtown. Parking at the hotel is free, while parking downtown during the day is expensive and hard to find- so the shuttle is a fine service. the free breakfast is pretty good and the dining area is pleasant. There is a Greek restaurant on site, but I didn't eat there, preferring a short walk to an Italian restaurant that was a two minute walk across a parking lot. The building is an 8 story, late 1960s style concrete rectangle; it looks kind of like a late 60s vintage college dormitory building. The area is pretty industrial, but it is easy to get to off of I-95 near its intersection with I-91. There is an IKEA store literally next door--some local maps show that but not the hotel--and it is also close to a bank, the Long Wharf Theater and a Mobil station; a post office is a short walk. Train station would be a bit under a mile walk away; not a scenic walk, but doable. Ditto downtown, but a bit farther--about a mile and a half. Small but decent outdoor pool on site; fitness room is small but clean and has an elliptical trainer, stationary bike and treadmill, but no free weights. Bed comfortable; hot water ample; room very clean except windows could have used cleaning. If I were visiting New Haven again, I would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and a good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious enough, two fairly comfy queen beds with clean soft-enough sheets and pillows weren't too lumpy.
reviews.title: Just fine for an affordable night in New Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wireless internet worked well and was, in fact, free.
reviews.title: Lots of perks....but

reviews.text: Great temperature control of the room.
reviews.title: Remodeled room for a fair price.

reviews.text: Free shuttle to downtown New Haven.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel May 9-May14th 2010. I was in New Haven for work at Yale New Haven Hosp. The hotel is right off the highway, easily accessable. I was traveling alone, so I got a standard queen bed room. I stayed here based on the reviews of this hotal, and reviews of other hotels in the area. It basically seemed the safest. The room was average, clean. Bed comfortable. Iron and hair dryer. The Wi-Fi was something less then to be desired. Every time I tried to connect it gave me the hardest time, and while I was here I had to call the hotels tech support 3 times, who were basically useless. It's a pretty big place, and was far from full, so it was annoying when they put people in the room next to me who were really loud, and may as well have been in the room with me. But that was only 2 nights. The continental breakfast was decent. Lots of bread, muffins, bagels, english muffins. Cereal, a belgium waffle maker and yogurt. Juices, coffee, tea. I think over all, it seems eqivalent to most other hotels, which made me rate the price poor. Between $83-$99, a night, but I guess it's better to pay a little bit more then be in a crappy area. This place is about 4 miles from Yale New Haven Hosp. There is a small diner next door......I ate there 3-4 times, and their food is good. If I came to New Haven again and needed a place to stay, I would stay here again!! OH! there is a pool in the back too. (covered while I was here)
reviews.title: Good Area, Fairly Decent, a little pricey

reviews.text: dated but great value for this area
reviews.title: dated but great value for this area
Pleasant experience
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel because I was traveling from out of state to attend my uncle's funeral. Didn't know much about the quality of the rooms but when we FINALLY made it into the room to settle down for the night, my family and I were more than pleased and satisfied. the room AND bathroom were clean. 1 improvement suggested: I didn't understand why there was a transparent shower curtain hanging up that wasn't wide enough to hide much of anything. whenever I return to New Haven, I wouldn't mind staying there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Quinta New Haven was a pleasant stay. Our room was mostly clean, the bathroom cleanliness was a bit sub standard. I am not complaining, I would say cleanliness overall was above average. The queen suite was large with a sofa/coffee table and desk seperated from the bedroom. Large flat screen TV was also nice. I would stay again and recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Good stay, easy to get to.

reviews.text: Side note: The restaurant that is attached is a small diner. Right behind the hotel is a nice Italian restaurant called Brazi's. Give it a shot if your into classic Italian food.
reviews.title: Want to avoid the drive into New York - stay here & take the train in!

reviews.text: The La Quinta is a basic hotel that is literally right off I-95. It has a bar and restaurant as well as a pool. I didn't use the pool, but it looked clean. The fitness room is cardio only. The hotel rooms were a decent size and clean. This hotel is good for business travelers or people on a long drive who need a rest. The free Wi-Fi is a plus.
reviews.title: Basic and Clean. Good For Business or Passing Through.

reviews.text: The hotel is located adjacent to a warehouse district. Although downtown New Haven is close to the hotel, the walk would not be advisable. Parking is free. The restaurant food is okay and the free breakfast is pretty good; it has the usual plus self-serve waffles.
reviews.title: Bit of a pain but excellent customer service

reviews.text: I stayed here last week while driving from MD to ME with my 22-month old daughter. We checked in very late at night after a harrowing day of driving. I had carried our things from the car to the lobby, a mistake as I'm 6 months pregnant and was also carrying my little girl. The girl at the front desk saw how frazzled and out of breath I was and had a coworker carry our things up to our room, which was SO helpful. The room itself was more than adequate. I'm not sure what other reviewers are talking about when they say this hotel is dirty. I certainly didn't encounter this, and I'm very picky about filth since I have a baby. The continental breakfast had everything you could want and then some. The only gripe I have about this hotel is regarding the room key. Before we checked out, I decided it made the most sense to make several trips out to the car with our things rather than try to carry it all at once. This would've worked out fine were it not for the fact that each time we went back up to retrieve more bags, our room key wouldn't work. This then necessitated many trips back and forth from the room to the front desk to have them reset the key. Sometimes the reset worked, but more often it did not. What would have been three trips turned into about thirty-five, and by the end I was absolutely exhausted from carrying my daughter. But the front-desk clerk was so apologetic about the problem, and eventually came up and opened the door for us herself. I would stay again, as long as they replace the doors (or the room keys; whichever is the cause of the problem).
reviews.title: Fabulous service

reviews.text: I stayed at the La Quinta for one night this month while attending a wedding shower and bachelorette party for a good friend. I was driving from Boston, and chose this hotel for the location (close to the highway and the party location) and the rate - $69 for a Saturday night. The hotel was no frills, but I was extremely satisfied with the service and amenities.
reviews.title: Cheap and dirty

reviews.text: When I arrived to check in, the two desk clerks were both on the phone, and one immediately asked her caller to hold in order to help me. Check in took approximately 1 minute, and the woman told me that if I needed absolutely anything at all, to come ask her at any time. Our room was on the sixth floor in the corner, so we had an entire corner bank of windows. The two queen beds were comfortable and nicely made, and I appreciated the large armchair in the corner.
reviews.title: Uneasy

aka: La Quinta Inn & Suites New Haven Hotel
